Race.SpecificTitle: Brownsfield FPD No. 3 -- $32 Serv. Chrg. - Metro.Coun. - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of the $32.00 per annum service charge for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for fire protection purposes within the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1502.1 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to renew the levy and collection, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a service charge of $32.00 per annum (the "Service Charge") (an estimated $116,500 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for an entire year), for each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge (which Service Charge shall be levied after the expiration of the service charge approved by the voters in the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 on November 7, 2000), in each calendar year, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2012 to and including the year 2021, and shall the avails or proceeds of the Service Charge (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Service Charge, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for fire protection purposes within the Brownsfield Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Zachary Com. Sch. Dist. No. 1 -- $40,000,000 Bonds - SB - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Zachary Community School District No. 1 Proposition
(Bond)

Summary:  Authority to issue not exceeding $40,000,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation Bonds of Zachary Community School District No. 1, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public.
Race.FullText: Shall the Zachary Community School District No. 1, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount not exceeding Forty Million Dollars ($40,000,000), to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding nine per centum (9%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Central FPD No. 4 Prop.#1 -- 5.0 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Central Fire Protection District No. 4 Propositions

Proposition No. 1

Summary:  Renewal of five (5.0) mills property tax for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for salaries, employee benefits and capital improvements of the Central Fire Protection District No. 4. (An estimated $650,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases.)
Race.FullText: Shall the Central Fire Protection District No. 4, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt a resolution providing for the renewal of the levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of five (5.0) mills (the "Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Central Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2013 to and including the year 2022, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for salaries, employee benefits, capital improvements and/or payment of debts and/or debt service associated with capital improvements of the Central Fire Protection District No. 4 within Central Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge? (An estimated $650,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases.)

Race.SpecificTitle: Central FPD No. 4 Prop.#2 -- Serv. Chrg. - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Central Fire Protection District No. 4 Propositions

Proposition No. 2

Summary:  Renewal of service charge not to exceed $32.00 per annum for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Central Fire Protection District No. 4. (An estimated $360,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the service charge for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the number of properties subject to service charge increases.)
Race.FullText: Shall the Central Fire Protection District No. 4, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (specifically La. R.S. 40:1502.1 et seq. and all amendatory thereto), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt a resolution providing for such levy and collection, of a service charge not to exceed $32.00 per annum from the owners of each residential or commercial structure located within Central Fire Protection District No. 4 (which Service Charge shall be levied after expiration of the service charge approved by the voters in the Central Fire Protection District No. 4 on November 7, 2000), in each calendar year on all such property in the Central Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2012 to and including the year 2021, and shall the avails or proceeds of said service charge be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Central Fire Protection District No. 4 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within Central Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge? (An estimated $360,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the number of properties subject to service charge increases.)

Race.SpecificTitle: St. George FPD No. 2 -- 1.25 Mills - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition

Summary:  Authorizing a nonrenewable 1.25 mill property tax for a period of five (5) years to provide for capital improvements for the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2.  (An estimated $1,250,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases.)
Race.FullText: Shall the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2, Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt a resolution providing for such levy and collection, of a nonrenewable ad valorem tax of 1.25 mills (the "Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge (an estimated $1,250,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases) for a period of five (5) years, commencing in the year 2011 to and including the year 2015, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for capital improvements including, but not limited to, building and development of fire stations and fire protection facilities for the St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 and within St. George Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Shenandoah CrmPrev&ImpDist. -- $50 parcel fee - BOC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Shenandoah Estates Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Five (5) year annual parcel fee of $50 beginning in 2011 for each improved parcel, whose owner does not qualify for and receive the special assessment level provided by Louisiana Constitution Article VII, Section 18(G)(1), said fee may be increased to an amount not to exceed $150 beginning in 2012, for the purpose of promoting and encouraging security, beautification and overall betterment of the Shenandoah Estates Crime Prevention and Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall Shenandoah Estates Crime Prevention and Improvement District ("District"), levy an annual parcel fee of fifty dollars ($50) on each improved parcel located in the District, less and except any parcel whose owner qualifies for and receives the special assessment level provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana, for a period of five (5) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2015 for the purpose of promoting and encouraging security in the area included within the District and promoting and encouraging the beautification and overall betterment of the District and all related matters as set forth in La. R.S. 33:9097.8, (an estimated $100,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the initial levy).  Said parcel fee may be increased to an amount not to exceed one hundred fifty dollars ($150) per improved parcel per calendar year beginning in 2012 by duly adopted resolution of the District's Board?

Race.SpecificTitle: Westminster Pine Park Crime Prev. -- $100 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Westminster Pine Park Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Authorization for the Westminster Pine Park Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District (the "District") to levy an annual fee on each improved parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00) resulting in estimated annual proceeds of approximately 
$57,000.00, which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2011, and ending on December 31, 2020, to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement and security patrols within the District and to provide for the maintenance and improvement of areas within the District.
Race.FullText: "Shall the Westminster Pine Park Crime Prevention and Neighborhood Improvement District (the "District"), acting through the Board of Commissioners of the District and the East Baton Rouge Parish Metropolitan Council, be authorized to levy and collect an annual fee on each improved parcel of land located within the boundaries of the District in the amount of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) resulting in estimated annual proceeds of approximately $57,000.00, which fee shall be levied for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2011, and ending on December 31, 2020, and which fee shall be collected by any means authorized by law for the collection of taxes, all as provided in La. R.S. 33:9097, with the proceeds of said fee (after deducting the reasonable and necessary costs of collecting said fee) to be used to aid in crime prevention and enhance security of District residents by providing for an increase of law enforcement and security patrols within the District and to provide for the maintenance and improvement of areas within the District?"
